title: Damnation (unrand)
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

|   |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | An unholy crossbow, forged in the fires of Gehenna. It imbues the bolts it fires with the raw power of its namesake. Thankfully, the blasts this weapon produces never harm the one firing. |

[![Urand damnation.png](/images/3/30/Urand_damnation.png)](/File:Urand_damnation.png) ***the +6 arbalest "Damnation"***

+6 [arbalest](/Arbalest "Arbalest")

Causes fired [bolts](/Bolt "Bolt") to explode with [damnation](/Damnation "Damnation") (2d14[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)) when striking a target  
[Evil](/Evil "Evil")

## Desirability

**Damnation**[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) is a decently enchanted arbalest with an amazing "[brand](/Brand "Brand")". A 100% chance for 2d14 damage is over ×4 stronger than [electrocution](/Electrocution "Electrocution"), it can hit multiple enemies in its 3×3 blast, and [damnation resistance](/Category:Damnation_resistance "Category:Damnation resistance") is exceedingly rare. Note that when used against adjacent targets, the blast will not harm you. The explosions Damnation generates are significantly louder than normal crossbow shots, so expect to wake up nearby foes.

As a primary weapon, Damnation is viable for the entirety of a 3-rune game (at least). A [triple crossbow](/Triple_crossbow "Triple crossbow") may be stronger, but it requires much more skill to get to mindelay.

[Dimensional Bullseye](/Dimensional_Bullseye "Dimensional Bullseye") doesn't work with this launcher.

This artefact can be found in many [Gehenna](/Gehenna "Gehenna"):7 vaults, but may also be generated randomly.

## History

- Prior to [0.31](/0.31 "0.31"), the unrand could harm the shooter when shooting at an adjacent target.
- Prior to [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), Damnation dealt 3d14 damnation damage, but always [mulched](/Mulch "Mulch") [bolts](/Bolt "Bolt") that it fired, in addition to the other [ranged weapon changes](/Ranged_weapons#history "Ranged weapons").
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), Damnation's bolts would explode wherever they landed, not requiring a hit target. By aiming at the ground with **f.** instead of **ff**, users could set off explosions near evasive enemies, or fire at adjacent enemies without worrying about recoil damage.
- Prior to [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), Damnation gave rF++, rC-, and [MR](/MR "MR")+.
- In [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), both the crossbow and its damage type were renamed to Damnation from Hellfire. Previously, hellfire damage was increased against fire vulnerability, but ignored fire resistance.
- Prior to [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"), Hellfire was a +6, +9 [crossbow](/Crossbow_\(item\) "Crossbow (item)").
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), it had the [flame](/Flame "Flame") brand.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [art-func.h:890](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.31.0/crawl-ref/source/art-func.h#L890) (0.31.0)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [art-data.txt:543](https://github.com/crawl/crawl/blob/0.31.0/crawl-ref/source/art-data.txt#L543) (0.31.0)
html:
Damnation (unrand)

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
An unholy crossbow, forged in the fires of Gehenna. It imbues the bolts it fires with the raw power of its namesake. Thankfully, the blasts this weapon produces never harm the one firing.

the +6 arbalest "Damnation"

+6 arbalest

Causes fired bolts to explode with damnation (2d14[1]) when striking a target
Evil

Desirability

Damnation[2] is a decently enchanted arbalest with an amazing "brand". A 100% chance for 2d14 damage is over ×4 stronger than electrocution, it can hit multiple enemies in its 3×3 blast, and damnation resistance is exceedingly rare. Note that when used against adjacent targets, the blast will not harm you. The explosions Damnation generates are significantly louder than normal crossbow shots, so expect to wake up nearby foes.

As a primary weapon, Damnation is viable for the entirety of a 3-rune game (at least). A triple crossbow may be stronger, but it requires much more skill to get to mindelay.

Dimensional Bullseye doesn't work with this launcher.

This artefact can be found in many Gehenna:7 vaults, but may also be generated randomly.

History

  • Prior to 0.31, the unrand could harm the shooter when shooting at an adjacent target.
  • Prior to 0.29, Damnation dealt 3d14 damnation damage, but always mulched bolts that it fired, in addition to the other ranged weapon changes.
  • Prior to 0.27, Damnation's bolts would explode wherever they landed, not requiring a hit target. By aiming at the ground with f. instead of ff, users could set off explosions near evasive enemies, or fire at adjacent enemies without worrying about recoil damage.
  • Prior to 0.19, Damnation gave rF++, rC-, and MR+.
  • In 0.18, both the crossbow and its damage type were renamed to Damnation from Hellfire. Previously, hellfire damage was increased against fire vulnerability, but ignored fire resistance.
  • Prior to 0.15, Hellfire was a +6, +9 crossbow.
  • Prior to 0.14, it had the flame brand.

References

  1. ↑ art-func.h:890 (0.31.0)
  2. ↑ art-data.txt:543 (0.31.0)
